title: Loco1887
author: Loco1887
content: What do you think about Elrond? Is it a good buy? Suppoman said its his 2nd best buy after Moonbeam

comments.author: CryptoATM
comments.body: Don't put all your eggs in one basket, Elrond isn't bad but the future will forever remains unknown to anyone, expand your bag with avalanche, Polkadot, and few other good altcoins, this is what's makes a good crypto portfolio for a long term.

comments.author: serjent05
comments.body: Quote from: Loco1887 on June 23, 2022, 06:53:27 AMWhat do you think about Elrond? Is it a good buy? Suppoman said its his 2nd best buy after Moonbeam It has been hyped heavily and dumped heavily.  From $542.58 it was dumped to the $30+ and now at $58.  Is Suppoman starting to hype these coins again?  This statement[1] that appeared from google search seems interesting.QuoteWalletInvestor describes the cryptocurrency as a “bad” long-term investment. It forecasts a continual climb for EGLD, which, it said, should drop to $4.25 by the end of 2022. Its Elrond price prediction for 2025 is for the coin to fluctuate around $1. That prediction looks scary but the following prediction after that all states a positive climb in price and an unrealistic projection of 5 digits per piece. Well just do your own research, you can use the reply on this thread as a reference but do not follow them until you have done your digging.[1] https://currency.com/elrond-price-prediction

comments.author: VRExpress
comments.body: I know Suppoman but believe me I only watch his videos a few times, he is good at choosing altcoins but mind you that doesn't mean he can't get fucked up as well, Terra Luna investors never saw that shit coming so that's crypto space for you, do your own research and invest only what you are ready to lose.

comments.author: Cryptoababe
comments.body: Elrond is a good project but I don't see many Devs using the Elrond network. For me, I prefer to buy a coin whc Devs are using on building on the network. Probably Elrond might be in use by a lot of builders in the future. So, Just buy any amount you can afford to lose.
